akas: If You Really Knew Me (original title)
akas from release info: If You Really Knew Me (original title)

1.title: Freedom High School: Oakley, CA

episode of.title: If You Really Knew Me (TV Series 2010– )

1.plot: Racism on the football team sparks a star athlete at Freedom High in Oakley, California, to enlist his teammates to stand up against school-wide intolerance.

2.title: Anthony Wayne High School: Whitehouse, OH

episode of.title: If You Really Knew Me (TV Series 2010– )

2.plot: Cyberbullying has become a vicious epidemic at Anthony Wayne High, near Toledo, Ohio. When three students realize the damage they've caused, they challenge the whole school to stop cyberbullying.

3.title: Riverside High: Belle, WV

episode of.title: If You Really Knew Me (TV Series 2010– )

3.plot: Camouflage is way of life at rural Riverside High, West Virginia, where even the homecoming queen hunts. But when a self-described "weirdo" reveals her painful past, the entire school aims to change her life.

4.title: Putnam City West: Oklahoma City, OK

episode of.title: If You Really Knew Me (TV Series 2010– )

4.plot: A shocking student death at Putnam City West High in Oklahoma City inspires students to take a new perspective on clique rivalries and on themselves.

5.title: Colusa High: Colusa, CA

episode of.title: If You Really Knew Me (TV Series 2010– )

5.plot: In the small town of Colusa, California, a label sticks for life. But a self-proclaimed nerd, who is teased daily, realizes that even he can be a bully sometimes, and makes a surprising apology.

6.title: Paris High: Paris, TX

episode of.title: If You Really Knew Me (TV Series 2010– )

6.plot: In Paris, Texas, tough guys never cry but when a towering football hero falls to his knees in tears, one fellow student reacts in an unexpected way.

7.title: Denver School of the Arts: Denver, CO

episode of.title: If You Really Knew Me (TV Series 2010– )

7.plot: Like the school in "Fame", everyone competes for the spotlight at Denver School of the Arts. But when the nerdy stage tech takes center stage to confront a glamorous leading man, the performance is anything but an act.

8.title: Neenah High: Neenah, WI

episode of.title: If You Really Knew Me (TV Series 2010– )

8.plot: A self-described "jock-hick" at All-American Neenah High, in Wisconsin, admits he's pressured to take on a tough guy role. But when he meets an openly gay Latino student, he must confront his prejudices.

9.title: Columbia High: Columbia, SC

episode of.title: If You Really Knew Me (TV Series 2010– )

9.plot: At predominately African-American Columbia High, in urban South Carolina, a shy white kid feels invisible until the student king of the cafeteria shows him how to work the crowd.

10.title: Granite Falls High: Granite Falls, WA

episode of.title: If You Really Knew Me (TV Series 2010– )

10.plot: Granite Falls High, near Seattle, is a school divided between the good students and the "alternative" kids. A preacher's daughter joins forces with an alternative school bad girl to unite the entire campus.

11.title: Rancocas Valley Regional High: Mt. Holly, NJ

episode of.title: If You Really Knew Me (TV Series 2010– )

11.plot: Rumors ruin reputations at Rancocas Valley High, called "Rumor Valley High," outside Philadelphia. But an Emo student's shocking reality inspires a victimizing popular kid to look beyond the gossip.

12.title: Royal Oaks High: Royal Oaks, MI

episode of.title: If You Really Knew Me (TV Series 2010– )

12.plot: At Royal Oak High, in suburban Detroit, a popular student council leader bonds with a meek freshman choirgirl to seek a truce with a vicious school bully.

imdb.plot outline: Follow high school students from different cliques as they experience a transformative one-day program that breaks down barriers between cliques, curbs prejudice and bullying, and changes the way the students view their school, and each other.
imdb.title: If You Really Knew Me
plot: Follow high school students from different cliques as they experience a transformative one-day program that breaks down barriers between cliques, curbs prejudice and bullying, and changes the way the students view their school, and each other.
